question_text:
The point B(-3,-5) is rotated 90° counterclockwise around the origin. What are the coordinates of the resulting point, B'?
_
backend_description: A coordinate grid showing point B at position (-3, -5) in Quadrant III. Students need to find the coordinates of B' when B is rotated 90° counterclockwise around the origin.
solution: 90° is a full turn. The rotation will turn the point of a full turn in the counterclockwise direction.
Start with the point B(-3,-5). Rotate the point 90° counterclockwise around the origin. The point will move from Quadrant III to Quadrant IV.
To find the exact location, imagine (0, 0) and B forming opposite corners of a box. Rotate the box, keeping the (0, 0) corner fixed.
B' has coordinates (5,-3).

question_text:

_

solution: 180° is a half turn. The rotation will turn the point a half turn in the clockwise direction.
Start with the point B(-10,-2). Rotate the point 180° clockwise around the origin. The point will move from Quadrant III to Quadrant I.
To find the exact location, imagine (0, 0) and B forming opposite corners of a box. Rotate the box, keeping the (0, 0) corner fixed.
B' has coordinates (10,2).

Start with the point F(-5,0). Rotate the point 90° counterclockwise around the origin. The point will move to a new position.
To find the exact location, imagine (0, 0) and F forming opposite corners of a box. Rotate the box, keeping the (0, 0) corner fixed.
F' has coordinates (0,-5).

question_text:
The point D(-9,0) is rotated 180° counterclockwise around the origin. What are the coordinates of the resulting point, D'?
_
backend_description: A coordinate grid showing point D at position (-9, 0) on the x-axis. Students need to find the coordinates of D' when D is rotated 180° counterclockwise around the origin.
solution: 180° is a half turn. The rotation will turn the point a half turn in the counterclockwise direction.
Start with the point D(-9,0). Rotate the point 180° counterclockwise around the origin. The point will move to a new position.
To find the exact location, imagine (0, 0) and D forming opposite corners of a box. Rotate the box, keeping the (0, 0) corner fixed.
D' has coordinates (9,0).

question_text:
The point Q(2,-5) is rotated 270° clockwise around the origin. What are the coordinates of the resulting point, Q'?
_
backend_description: A coordinate grid showing point Q at position (2, -5) in Quadrant IV. Students need to find the coordinates of Q' when Q is rotated 270° clockwise around the origin.
solution: 270° is three-quarters of a turn. The rotation will turn the point three-quarters of a turn in the clockwise direction.
Start with the point Q(2,-5). Rotate the point 270° clockwise around the origin. The point will move from Quadrant IV to Quadrant I.
To find the exact location, imagine (0, 0) and Q forming opposite corners of a box. Rotate the box, keeping the (0, 0) corner fixed.
Q' has coordinates (5,2).
